text: Instances of classes are initialised via constructors. Which one of the following statements is TRUE?

answers.text: A class can have more than one constructor, as long as they have a different number of arguments, or the arguments have different types.
A class can have more than one constructor, but only one of them can be a void method.
A class can have more than one constructor, as long as they all have different names.
A class can have more than one constructor, but only if they each have a different number of arguments.
A class can have more than one constructor, as long as they have the same number and types of arguments.
